definition: historical records
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
surname Shi
book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership
surname Ji

sentences.english: Dongshi Shu is a historical book that records how the Ming Dynasty managed Liaotung.
sentences.chinese: 《東事書》是一部記述明代經營遼東的史籍。

sentences.english: The emergency of new historical data could timely supply the insufficient historical records.
sentences.chinese: 新材料的出現往往能填補史籍載記之不足。

sentences.english: Biography, describes the history books all kinds of characters.
sentences.chinese: 傳記，記述各類人物的史籍。

sentences.english: Political books, history books recorded in various institutions.
sentences.chinese: 政書，記載典章制度的史籍。

sentences.english: In the pre-Qin to other historical records, but also no lack of ethnic tolerance frontier.
sentences.chinese: 在先秦其他史籍中，亦不乏對邊地民族的寬容態度。

sentences.english: In the historical literatures of Ming dynasty, Queen Sun of Emperor Xuan Zong was respected.
sentences.chinese: 在明代史籍中，對宣宗孫皇后多有褒詞。

sentences.english: Have you thought about the history of this place?
sentences.chinese: 你們是否琢磨過這個地方的史籍呢？

sentences.english: The statement of "One Pavilion Every Ten Li" in historical materials of the Qin and Han Dynasties is not true.
sentences.chinese: 秦漢史籍所謂的“十里一亭”之說是不足憑信的。

sentences.english: History notes, excerpt of the history books history books.
sentences.chinese: 史鈔，摘抄史部書的史籍。

definition: history book
historical material or data
the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
to write down/to record/written account
historical biography

books (in Confucian education)

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
History of the Northern Dynasties, fifteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Li Yanshou 李延壽|李延寿[Li3 Yan2 shou4] in 659 during Tang Dynasty, 100 scrolls
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
